name: generic_scene_graph
description: An attempt to make a scene graph that is easy to understand and use, and decoupled from the rendering technology

scripts.build-debug: cd build/`hostname`/Debug   && cmake --build . && echo Build succeeded
scripts.build-release: cd build/`hostname`/Release && cmake --build . && echo Build succeeded
scripts.build-xcode: cd build/`hostname`/Xcode   && cmake --build . && echo Build succeeded
scripts.config-debug: del-cli build/`hostname`/Debug   && make-dir build/`hostname`/Debug   && cd build/`hostname`/Debug   && cmake ../../.. -DCMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE=ON -DGSG_BUILD_TESTS=ON -DGSG_ENABLE_CODE_COVERAGE=ON -GNinja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug
scripts.config-release: del-cli build/`hostname`/Release && make-dir build/`hostname`/Release && cd build/`hostname`/Release && cmake ../../.. -DCMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE=ON -DGSG_BUILD_TESTS=ON -DGSG_ENABLE_CODE_COVERAGE=ON -GNinja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
scripts.config-xcode: del-cli build/`hostname`/Xcode   && make-dir build/`hostname`/Xcode   && cd build/`hostname`/Xcode   && cmake ../../.. -DCMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE=ON -DGSG_BUILD_TESTS=ON -DGSG_ENABLE_CODE_COVERAGE=ON -GXcode
scripts.echo: for n in {1..20}; do echo; done
scripts.watch-debug: watch "npm run echo && npm run build-debug   && npm run test-debug   && npm run coverage-debug   && echo watching ..." ./ --filter=./watch_filter.js
scripts.watch-release: watch "npm run echo && npm run build-release && npm run test-release && npm run coverage-release && echo watching ..." ./ --filter=./watch_filter.js
scripts.watch-xcode: watch "npm run echo && npm run build-xcode   && npm run test-xcode                               && echo watching ..." ./ --filter=./watch_filter.js

author: Perry L Miller IV
